byline.original: By MICHAEL M. GRYNBAUM and THOMAS KAPLAN

abstract: New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo and New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio hold separate events simultaneously to discuss Legionnaires' disease outbreak in South Bronx and seem to provide conflicting information; despite communication breakdown, both insist their administrations are working closely together to address outbreak, which has sickened 113 people since early July.
lead_paragraph: In a communication breakdown later attributed to a missed voice mail message, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo and Mayor Bill de Blasio appeared to present conflicting information at simultaneous events.

headline.main: Separate Briefings, and Findings, on Legionnaires’ Disease Outbreak
headline.print_headline: City and State Hold Conflicting Briefings

snippet: In a communication breakdown later attributed to a missed voice mail message, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo and Mayor Bill de Blasio appeared to present conflicting information at simultaneous events.
